So now, if I have to help you explain, how the *Earn While You Learn Program* helps a student make higher education affordable and comparable to Local Universities. Let us take an example wherein we assume the annual fee to be $2200 a year. Now if you manage to self-finance scholarship credits worth $100 in a month, this means that you can self-finance $1200 in a year, and that would basically bring the cost further down to $1000 per year which includes the cost of tuition, food and accommodation, which means for the family monthly cost of the student‚Äôs education would be somewhere between $90-$100 a month
125 - 12 Jan 2024 01:00PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: NOTE:- This does not mean that there is any limit up to which a student can earn scholarship credits. 126 - 12 Jan 2024 01:00PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: So for example, if after the scholarship the annual fee of the student comes to be let us say $2200, now to the University it has to be paid Semester Wise ( 2 Installments of 6 months each). Therefore it is paid like $1100 in the first semester and $1100 in the next semester, but there would be the Earn While You Learn Program which would help the student in reducing the semester fee as well.  Usually what parents do is, since after arriving in India students do get an Indian Bank Account opened, parents can also deposit the fee on a monthly basis into the students account and the student in one go can complete the semester fee after the interval of 6 months itself!

103 - 12 Jan 2024 04:19PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Technology in Aerospace Engineering* is a four-year undergraduate program in engineering. Minimum eligibility criteria for which is qualified A-level with Physics, and Mathematics as compulsory subjects.  BTech Aerospace Engineering is a primary branch of engineering which elaborates about the basic components of an aircraft such as its design and the science behind it.  Aerospace engineering opens up a lot of opportunities for the pursuers. They can be employed in governmental organizations and ample job opportunities are available in private sectors too.  *What is it About?*  Aerospace Engineering deals with aircraft that stay within the atmosphere of earth and also with those that operate outside the earth‚Äôs atmosphere. It is an applied discipline of engineering dealing with making, designing, manufacturing, functioning, and maintenance of vehicles such as aircraft, spacecraft, and missiles.  BTech Aerospace Engineering involves the study and practice of physical science and mathematics to perform research. The core areas of specialization for a team of aerospace engineers include aerodynamics, thermodynamics, control system, propulsion, celestial mechanics, and electronics.  Study of Aerospace engineering has evolved a great deal in the country with advanced educational facilities offered by a number of institutes offering diploma and degree courses in aerospace engineering.  *What are the BTech Aerospace Engineering Career Prospects?*  BTech. Aerospace Engineering offers candidates some of the most exciting opportunities and jobs in some of the top companies and reputed sectors. With a number of private companies and ventures entering into aerospace technology, the opportunities are getting bigger and better.  This field gives candidates the freedom to become a pilot or an opportunity to roam in space. Following are the job prospects that can be considered by B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering candidates-  Most of the candidates are hired by Space Research Organisations. Other Candidates are offered jobs in prestigious departments like- *National Aeronautical Laboratory* *Civil Aviation Department* *Hindustan Aeronautics Limited* *Defense Research and Development Laboratories* *Candidates can also opt for green pastures in a foreign country.*  *What is the Future of a BTech Aerospace Engineering Student?*  A BTech Aerospace Engineering student may acquire prestigious jobs in the various Aerospace Engineering sectors. Few of the popular sectors for the BTech Aerospace Engineering students are the energy sector, oil and petroleum sector, power generation sector, engineering consultancy, pharmaceutical sector.  The candidates may go for higher studies. A lot of engineering students opt for an MTech or an MBA after they complete their BTech course. This is especially meant for those students who wish to remain in the academic field and carry out research activities.  The BTech Aerospace Engineering students can look for jobs in the government and private companies. They may directly apply for jobs in private companies after completion of the course. For jobs in government offices, they need to appear for additional examinations.  Some of the most popular job profiles for the BTech Aerospace Engineering engineers are Senior Aerospace Manager, Lecturer, Professor, Maintenance Engineer, Mechanical Engineer and many more.

103 - 12 Jan 2024 04:19PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Technology in Aerospace Engineering* is a four-year undergraduate program in engineering. Minimum eligibility criteria for which is qualified A-level with Physics, and Mathematics as compulsory subjects.  BTech Aerospace Engineering is a primary branch of engineering which elaborates about the basic components of an aircraft such as its design and the science behind it.  Aerospace engineering opens up a lot of opportunities for the pursuers. They can be employed in governmental organizations and ample job opportunities are available in private sectors too.  *What is it About?*  Aerospace Engineering deals with aircraft that stay within the atmosphere of earth and also with those that operate outside the earth‚Äôs atmosphere. It is an applied discipline of engineering dealing with making, designing, manufacturing, functioning, and maintenance of vehicles such as aircraft, spacecraft, and missiles.  BTech Aerospace Engineering involves the study and practice of physical science and mathematics to perform research. The core areas of specialization for a team of aerospace engineers include aerodynamics, thermodynamics, control system, propulsion, celestial mechanics, and electronics.  Study of Aerospace engineering has evolved a great deal in the country with advanced educational facilities offered by a number of institutes offering diploma and degree courses in aerospace engineering.  *What are the BTech Aerospace Engineering Career Prospects?*  BTech. Aerospace Engineering offers candidates some of the most exciting opportunities and jobs in some of the top companies and reputed sectors. With a number of private companies and ventures entering into aerospace technology, the opportunities are getting bigger and better.  This field gives candidates the freedom to become a pilot or an opportunity to roam in space. Following are the job prospects that can be considered by B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering candidates-  Most of the candidates are hired by Space Research Organisations. Other Candidates are offered jobs in prestigious departments like- *National Aeronautical Laboratory* *Civil Aviation Department* *Hindustan Aeronautics Limited* *Defense Research and Development Laboratories* *Candidates can also opt for green pastures in a foreign country.*  *What is the Future of a BTech Aerospace Engineering Student?*  A BTech Aerospace Engineering student may acquire prestigious jobs in the various Aerospace Engineering sectors. Few of the popular sectors for the BTech Aerospace Engineering students are the energy sector, oil and petroleum sector, power generation sector, engineering consultancy, pharmaceutical sector.  The candidates may go for higher studies. A lot of engineering students opt for an MTech or an MBA after they complete their BTech course. This is especially meant for those students who wish to remain in the academic field and carry out research activities.  The BTech Aerospace Engineering students can look for jobs in the government and private companies. They may directly apply for jobs in private companies after completion of the course. For jobs in government offices, they need to appear for additional examinations.  Some of the most popular job profiles for the BTech Aerospace Engineering engineers are Senior Aerospace Manager, Lecturer, Professor, Maintenance Engineer, Mechanical Engineer and many more.

28 - 12 Jan 2024 01:45PM - +263 77 637 1431: My autobiography  I am a holder of bachelor of social science honours in Sociology and Gender development studies.My degree class is 2.2 from Women's University in Africa in Zimbabwe.l would want to pursue a Masters degree in Social Sciences eg Masters in Sociology, Development Studies,Gender Studies,International relations,or Political Sciences.I also would seek your advice on the masters to pursue.My biological mother is a widow.My father died in 2010 when l was still at university.My surviving biological mother is not employed,she is into farming.My mother's highest level of education is ordinary level but she did not do well but can speak English fluently.Nobody has been supporting my education as of now,my widowed mother is the one who paid my university fees through farming.I believe if by God's mercy l am to get a scholarship my biological mother will continue to help me financially through  farming.I have numerous siblings but most of them are not employed.my biological sister are all married and are not employed.Only my biological brother is a policeman in Zimbabwe.I did my ordinary level at a rural school in Zimbabwe.l must say l have a strong rural background in terms of education.l.learnt at Chakadini Seconday and for advanced level l went to St Nicholas Mahusekwa High.St Nicholas Mahusekwa high is located in Mashonaland East province.I went for my honours degree at Women's University in Africa and while there l paid 800usd through my widowed biological mother's farm produce.After graduating from the University l failed to get a job.Since 2012 l have not been employed.l.have been helping my biological mother at farm who was expecting much from me upon graduating.Sadly,l did not get that job despite the fact that l have a degree.l have seen Edoofa as my only beacon of hope to further studies and have a taste of getting employed

13 - 12 Jan 2024 12:36PM - Shubham Madhwal: So let me further elaborate to you on the Edoofa Scholarship Program Edoofa Scholarship Program is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4500 students from different countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability is driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!  You know we have been helping students from the African nations and the SAARC countries for the past 6 years and in the short span of 6 years, the most common feedback which we hear from the students is how the Edoofa Program makes the higher education affordable through the financial aid and how it helps the students to make a financial plan to make sure that their dream of higher education abroad is fulfilled.
14 - 12 Jan 2024 12:36PM - Shubham Madhwal: Basically, our motive is that by providing the SEELS (Students of Edoofa Earning and Learning to Success) initiative, we help our students in Planning and Giving them opportunities through which they can help themselves by self-sponsoring their higher education at the least annual Fee Possible.

73 - 12 Jan 2024 02:12PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Technology in Aerospace Engineering* is a four-year undergraduate program in engineering. Minimum eligibility criteria for which is qualified A-level with Physics, and Mathematics as compulsory subjects.  BTech Aerospace Engineering is a primary branch of engineering which elaborates about the basic components of an aircraft such as its design and the science behind it.  Aerospace engineering opens up a lot of opportunities for the pursuers. They can be employed in governmental organizations and ample job opportunities are available in private sectors too.  *What is it About?*  Aerospace Engineering deals with aircraft that stay within the atmosphere of earth and also with those that operate outside the earth‚Äôs atmosphere. It is an applied discipline of engineering dealing with making, designing, manufacturing, functioning, and maintenance of vehicles such as aircraft, spacecraft, and missiles.  BTech Aerospace Engineering involves the study and practice of physical science and mathematics to perform research. The core areas of specialization for a team of aerospace engineers include aerodynamics, thermodynamics, control system, propulsion, celestial mechanics, and electronics.  Study of Aerospace engineering has evolved a great deal in the country with advanced educational facilities offered by a number of institutes offering diploma and degree courses in aerospace engineering.  *What are the BTech Aerospace Engineering Career Prospects?*  BTech. Aerospace Engineering offers candidates some of the most exciting opportunities and jobs in some of the top companies and reputed sectors. With a number of private companies and ventures entering into aerospace technology, the opportunities are getting bigger and better.  This field gives candidates the freedom to become a pilot or an opportunity to roam in space. Following are the job prospects that can be considered by B.Tech. Aerospace Engineering candidates-  Most of the candidates are hired by Space Research Organisations. Other Candidates are offered jobs in prestigious departments like- *National Aeronautical Laboratory* *Civil Aviation Department* *Hindustan Aeronautics Limited* *Defense Research and Development Laboratories* *Candidates can also opt for green pastures in a foreign country.*  *What is the Future of a BTech Aerospace Engineering Student?*  A BTech Aerospace Engineering student may acquire prestigious jobs in the various Aerospace Engineering sectors. Few of the popular sectors for the BTech Aerospace Engineering students are the energy sector, oil and petroleum sector, power generation sector, engineering consultancy, pharmaceutical sector.  The candidates may go for higher studies. A lot of engineering students opt for an MTech or an MBA after they complete their BTech course. This is especially meant for those students who wish to remain in the academic field and carry out research activities.  The BTech Aerospace Engineering students can look for jobs in the government and private companies. They may directly apply for jobs in private companies after completion of the course. For jobs in government offices, they need to appear for additional examinations.  Some of the most popular job profiles for the BTech Aerospace Engineering engineers are Senior Aerospace Manager, Lecturer, Professor, Maintenance Engineer, Mechanical Engineer and many more.
